quotes.quote: Apologizing does not always mean that you are wrong and the other person is right. It just means that you value your relationship more than your ego.
It's easier to apologize than ask for permission.
An apology is the superglue of life. It can repair just about anything.
More people should apologize, and more people should accept apologies when sincerely made.
You can't spend your life apologizing.
The ability of a person to atone has always been the most remarkable of human features.
A stiff apology is a second insult. The injured party does not want to be compensated because he has been wronged; he wants to be healed because he has been hurt.
The best way to have the last word is to apologize.
When you realize you've made a mistake, make amends immediately. It's easier to eat crow while it's still warm.
Nothing wrong with apologizing, but saying I'm sorry does nothing when you continue to make the same mistakes.
It is polite to apologize, but it is more polite not to do anything calling for an apology.
When an apology is due, give it freely, then follow your apology with action.
Apologizing - a very desperate habit - one that is rarely cured.
It is a good rule in life never to apologize. The right sort of people do not want apologies, and the wrong sort take a mean advantage of them.
Never apologize for showing feeling. When you do so you apologize for truth.
To apologize is to lay the foundation for a future offense.
Apologies are pointless, regrets come too late. What matters is you can move on, you can grow, you can do better in the future.
To apologize for what you most wanted to do, to concede that it was obnoxious, boring, 'vulgar and unsafe' --- that was the worst thing.
One cannot apologize for something fundamental, and a child feels and knows this as well and as deeply as any sage.
It never hurts to apologize, especially if you don't mean it.
Apologize quickly when you wrong someone, because I'm sorry has no value in the grave.
Apologize! That's the least you can do to try to make right something you have wronged.
Never apologize and never explain-it's a sign of weakness.
When someone says that it's too late for apologize then you have to do it anyway because it's your duty.
I apologize for apologizing.Thank you.
The first to apologize is the bravest. The first to forgive is the strongest. The first to move forward is the happiest.
Never ruin an apology with an excuse.
Never apologize when you are right unless it is to your wife.

It takes a great deal of character strength to apologize quickly out of one's heart rather than out of pity. A person must possess himself and have a deep sense of security in fundamental principles and values in order to genuinely apologize.
Never make a defense or an apology until you are accused.
Being sorry is the highest act of selfishness, seeing value only after discarding it.
Apologies only account for that which they do not alter.
Sacrifice is at the heart of repentance. Without deeds, your apology is worthless.
In this life, when you deny someone an apology, you will remember it at time you beg forgiveness..
A person can apologize endlessly, and even if you forgive them, sometimes you can't forget the pain they've caused you.
Saying 'I'm sorry' is saying 'I love you' with a wounded heart in one hand and your smothered pride in the other.
You can always say sorry but the real apology is when you hear the sadness in their voice and see the look in their eyes. And you realize that they have hurt themselves just as much.
A truly humble apology works to part storm clouds, calm rough seas, and bring on the soft lights of dawn; it has the power to change a person's world.
Apologies are great, but they don't really change anything. You know what does? Action.
I can wholeheartedly apologize for not being at all sorry. And it really is the least I can do.
I have learned that sometimes "sorry" is not enough. Sometimes you actually have to change.
Would 'sorry' have made any difference? Does it ever? It's just a word. One word against a thousand actions.
In some families, please is described as the magic word. In our house, however, it was sorry.
An apology might help, but you can change your life without one.
Right actions in the future are the best apologies for bad actions in the past.
An apology is an expression of regret where the voice rarely matches the words
An apology is saying the right thing after doing the wrong thing.
Actions speak louder than words. We can apologize over and over, but if our actions don't change, the words become meaningless.
